page.title: 01Coast Between Dunghallain
page.content: This block is a coastal area. It is mainly sea with a few very small rocky islands. The coast is very rocky & there are long areas of rock and pebbles jutting out into the sea. Some of these stones are used for road works etc. In this block there are several beaches both sandy and rocky. Lobster fishing is carried out along the coast. There A minibus & a post bus regularly take passengers several times a week. Near the sea there are two rocky hills. One is an ancient fort and the other has an old coastguard lookout post. The rest of the land is mostly flat grassland used for grazing sheep and cattle. A lot of this land is bog . The dry land is also used as a golf course. Part of this grassland has been fenced off and used as an airstrip. There is no regular service but private planes
